subject: AI
title: RAG in Production
description: Operational considerations for production RAG systems.

hook.text: Your RAG prototype works perfectly on 10 test queries. You deploy it and real users break it in ways you never imagined.

buildup.text: Production RAG needs: monitoring (latency, retrieval quality, answer quality), logging (every query, every retrieval, every response), caching (repeated queries), and graceful degradation (what happens when the vector DB is down?).

discovery.text: Build a feedback loop: let users flag bad answers, log the query + retrieved chunks + response, and review flagged cases weekly. This is your best source of real-world eval data.

twist.text: The biggest production surprise: users ask questions your knowledge base doesn't cover. Without a 'I don't know' path, the system hallucinates confidently. Handle out-of-scope queries explicitly.

climax.text: Treat RAG like any production system: observability, alerts, fallback paths, and continuous improvement. The prototype is 20% of the work.

punchline.text: Demo-ready is not production-ready. The gap is monitoring, edge cases, and graceful failure.

quiz.question: What's the most common production surprise in RAG systems?
options: The vector database is too fast
Users ask questions the knowledge base doesn't cover
